name: PlayStation Shader Language File
summary: A PSSL file is a shader file used by a PlayStation video game. If encountered in a binary format, the file contains binary code used to produce in-game shading, lighting, and other VFX effects. If encountered in a text format, it includes text source code that is meant to be compiled to binary. The code that PSSL files include is written in the PlayStation Shader Language (PSSL).
